Title: Intermediate Care Beds (ICBs) for Wiltshire
Description:
Wiltshire Council, in partnership with Wiltshire Clinical Commissioning Group, is seeking to commission Intermediate Care Beds (ICBs) for Wiltshire.
The purpose of ICBs is to support people who meet the eligibility criteria as they are discharged from acute and community hospitals or as a short-term measure as a step-up service from home. ICBs are short term, time restricted, goal-based periods of care that calls on a mixture of health and social care interventions to support people to maximise their potential to live as independently as possible by recovering or continuing to improve skills as a result of those interventions.

Title: Non-weight bearing beds provision
Description: Bedded care for 24 patients who are prescribed a period of non-weight bearing (NWB following surgery or injury, have identified potential for rehabilitation and who are unable to return to their usual place of residence during this period.  All possible strategies must be utilised to enable patients to return to their usual place of residence both prior to transfer from ESHT acute hospitals and throughout their stay with the NWB rehabilitation service.  Following review and amendment of weight-bearing status at orthopaedic out-patient clinic, a review of the patient must be undertaken by the NWB Therapy Team to ascertain whether return home or transfer to rehabilitation bed is the best course.  For clarity, the requirement is for x24 beds to be available for the provision of the service 365(6) days of the year, therefore it is expected that there may be periods when beds are unoccupied and available for new patients.  Upon vacation, beds must be available for re-occupation within 24 hours.  The NWB status may apply to either lower or upper limb.  In the case of upper limb, this may prevent a patient using any walking aid and if this is their usual means of walking, prevent them from doing so throughout the period of NWB.

Organisation Name: N H S Wakefield Clinical Commissioning Group
Title: NHS Wakefield CCG: Nursing Home AQP
Description:
Nationally there are approximately 416,000 people in the UK living in care homes the majority being over the age of 65 years. Many care home residents live with long term multiple health problems and also have "end of life" needs requiring holistic care planning and delivery by skilled and experienced staff. 

This specification is intended to outline the expected outcomes the CCG wants to see for individuals in nursing homes in receipt of NHS Healthcare funding. 

Its contents provide an overview of what we would expect to see delivered in order that service users are provided for and supported to lead as fulfilling and holistic life as possible, and to die with dignity and respect. 

This specification does not substitute for a service user's care plan as it would be expected their care plan will be one which is individualised and tailored to meet their changing care needs, and should be considered in conjunction with this specification.

Objectives:

•	To provide high quality care through experienced, competent, supported and trained workforce. 
•	To improve the service users' health and wellbeing and ensure their safety thus reducing hospital admission. 
•	To have care needs met in a way that puts the service user at the centre. 
•	To provide good quality care that meets the required and expected standards of Nursing Home providers.
•	To provide a clean safe environment for service users. 
•	To provide a calm and stable environment for service users.
•	To establish effective links with and work in close collaboration with other Health and Social Care Services to support service users' care.
Additional Text:
It is anticipated that this tender will open on the 17 October 2019.

If you would like to submit a tender for this service, please express your interest by registering on the BRAVO eprocurement portal website https://www.nhssourcing.co.uk, reference itt_4959.

Once registered potential providers will be able to complete their submission.

The CCG reserves the right to withdraw this notice or to amend anticipated timelines.

Title: Residential Care (with or without Nursing)
Description:
Essex County Council are letting a framework agreement for Care in a residential setting with or without nursing within the county of Essex. The commissioning participants are as follows : 
Essex County Council 
Mid Essex Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG)
West Essex CCG
North East Essex CCG 
Basildon and Brentwood CCG 
Castlepoint and Rochford CCG 
Southend CCG 
This is a notice for social and specific services in accordance with directive 2014/24/EU Article 74 Health, Social and related services.

This contract will establish a framework agreement which will have 3 lots.
 Lot 1 Residential Care - social care placements ; 
Lot 2 Residential Care with Nursing (Social Care Placements) 
Lot 3 NHS Funded Care  - CCG placements.
The contract for Lots 1 &2 (Essex County Council social care placements) shall be for a period of 3 years with annual break clauses. This will operate on a preferred supplier ranked list with quality scored 60% and Price 40% 
The contract for Lot 3 (NHS Funded Care) will be for a period of 1 year with the option to extend for a further year. This will operate in that the Patient will be given choice of all available providers who are able to meet their needs. 
Call offs against both contracts will be for individual service users or patients with identified needs and meeting the required relevant criteria.
This includes Social Care requirements for residents over the age of 65 and those with enduring mental health needs. Patients of all ages who are eligible for NHS funded Care.
The commissioning objectives are to:
•Commission a residential and nursing provision that is safe, of high quality, sustainable, innovative and able to meet future demand and deliver qualitative outcomes;
•Ensure standardised specifications and quality criteria are in place for all homes in Essex, managed through a robust supplier relationship and contract management approach;
•Deliver Better Patient/Customer experience – right solutions, at the right time, in the right environment

Title: Provider Panel for Intermediate Care Plus (IC+) Beds within County Durham via a spot purchase arrangement.
Description:
The primary objective of the Contract is to provide services that support Intermediate Care Services across County Durham.  The Council requires a number of spot purchase beds that are spread across the County.
The spot purchase of beds will be at a stated rate which is dependent on the type of service (bed functionality).The Provider Panel is to be made of multiple providers (on a non-exclusive basis).  There are no restrictions to the number of Providers who may be members of the Provider Panel, only that they meet all the requirements of this Invitation to Tender and Service Specification. The Council reserves the right to allow any additional Bidder(s) to apply to join the Provider Panel at a future date at the Council’s sole discretion provided that they fully meet the essential criteria contained in this document.
The number of beds required is flexible but will be required across all areas of County Durham

Title: Phase 4 of the pan-London continuing healthcare in care homes with nursing AQP contract
Description:
This is a contract award notice notifying the market of the successful conclusion of phase 4 of the AQP for the provision of Continuing Healthcare in Care Homes with Nursing. 

This AQP process was undertaken by the London Purchased Healthcare (LPHC) team on behalf of the following NHS Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs), the Contracting Authorities:

Barking & Dagenham, City & Hackney, Havering, Newham, Redbridge, Tower Hamlets, Waltham Forest, Bexley, Bromley, Greenwich, Lambeth, Lewisham, Southwark, Croydon, Kingston, Merton, Richmond, Sutton, Wandsworth, Camden, Islington and Barnet CCGs.

The phase 4 AQP procurement resulted in contracts being awarded to the following providers: 

Advinia Health Care, Care Plus Limited, Care UK Community Partnerships Ltd, CHD Living, CHD Living Ltd, Folkestone Nursing Home Ltd, FSHC Frenchay Properties Limited, Glebe Care Ltd, HC-One Limited, Hill House Nursing Home Ltd, Mr T.Lewis, Mrs Salima Nurmohamed & Mr Rahim Nurmohamed and The Grange (Chertsey) 2002 Ltd.
